title: Judge Rules Banks Must Stand Trial Over $7 Billion R. Allen Stanford Fraud Claims
sub_head: Judge finds services of major banks may have helped fraudster R. Allen Stanford
body:
Toronto-Dominion Bank, HSBC Bank PLC and other banks linked to convicted fraudster R. Allen Stanford must stand trial over claims they supported his $7 billion Ponzi scheme and should repay defrauded investors, a federal judge ruled.
Judge David Godbey of the U.S. District Court in Dallas on Thursday denied a request by the banks to avoid trial in a lawsuit brought on behalf of investors bilked by Mr. Stanford, citing evidence the banks knew his operation wasnâ€™t on the level but still did business with him.
